Articles.Content:
How possible is this?

Basically, in the Star Wars setting. Onderon and Dxun have an orbit type where both the planet and the moon overlap each others' atmospheres.

This means that flying creatures in Star Wars, and airplanes in KSP are able to travel from one moon to the other without having to break the atmosphere boundary.

I don't really have an idea how to make planets or settings myself in the Planetfactory CE mod, but have others tried this?

Check out roche limit on wikipedia.

Basically, if two planetary bodies get too close to each other, bad things happen to them.

I've moved planets like Laythe into Kerbin.

Bad things happened.

Conclusion is, don't move planets like Laythe into Kerbin.

Hu have you tried editing the game files and using hyper edit?

iv tried it and it worked but then i deleted the save i thought it was useless
